intro: Phacelia zaragozana, commonly known as Zaragoza phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Spain. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phacelia zaragozana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
